item.title: Code in Motion: Integrating Computational Thinking with Kinematics Exploration
item.description: arXiv:2503.03850v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Although physics has become increasingly computational, with computing even being considered the third pillar of physics [1], it is still not well integrated into physics education [2]. Research suggests that integrating Computational Thinking (CT) into physics enhances conceptual understanding and strengthens students ability to model and analyze phenomena [3]. Building on this, we designed a didactic sequence for K9 students to foster specific CT practices while reinforcing fundamental kinematics concepts. Assessments highlight student's ability to apply CT skills to analyze accelerated motion. This activity can be seamlessly integrated into introductory kinematics courses.
item.dc:creator: Mateo Dutra, \'Alvaro Su\'arez, Arturo C. Marti
